parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness. From chrestos; usefulness, i.e. Morally, excellence.
And, even, also, namely.
(lit: sheerness, of a rock), abruptness, harshness, severity, rigor. From the base of apotomos; decisiveness, i.e. Rigor.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
(lit: sheerness, of a rock), abruptness, harshness, severity, rigor. From the base of apotomos; decisiveness, i.e. Rigor.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness. From chrestos; usefulness, i.e. Morally, excellence.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I remain, tarry, (b) I remain in, persist in. From epi and meno; to stay over, i.e. Remain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness. From chrestos; usefulness, i.e. Morally, excellence.
Of time: when, after; of cause: since, because; otherwise: else. From epi and ei; thereupon, i.e. Since.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To cut out (off, away), remove, prevent. From ek and kopto; to exscind; figuratively, to frustrate.
